Registered as Y. 0-06, the vacant land of the immovable property was inherited by her, and some immovable property was encroached upon in the same manner, and the remaining Y. 0-03 or Sq. G. 145. 2s
of the land was constructed with her own money, a reed shed, buildings, etc., and she paid the tax, etc. to the Panchayat, and explained the arrangements to be made for the property in the future, and wrote a will dated 06-08-2021, which was notarized by Mattapalli Suguna Rao Having made the said will, without any changes or additions, it is their last will and testament. It was executed on 02-11-2021. After her death, the above mentioned property has come into effect and I am enjoying it in my possession and rights. In recognition of the natural love and affection I have for you and out of the filial affection I have for you, I have transferred to you the immovable property as per the schedule below, which is part of the property inherited by me in the manner mentioned above, free of charge, and I have transferred the transfer to you on this day itself. You shall pay all taxes payable on the schedule property out of this amount, and the schedule property, In the event of such loss, you, your heirs, your heirs, your heirs, etc., shall have the right to enjoy the said property with all due rights and obligations. I, my heirs, my heirs, etc., shall have no right to any dispute whatsoever with regard to this property. I, my heirs, my heirs, etc., shall at any time and from any cause whatsoever, settle all such disputes with regard to this property, whether by my heirs or by any other person, and shall, at our own expense, establish this property and continue to exercise your right, and shall indemnify you in full against all losses and expenses incurred by you. I hereby grant you the Scheduled Property. I hereby give you this deed of transfer in your name, and hereby declare that I have not committed any other offence to any other person except for the purpose of transferring the said property to you, that I have no right or obligation whatsoever, including but not limited to any court attachment, injunction, joint share certificate, other agreements, or other securities, and that I am the sole owner of the said property and have full and undisputed right to transfer the said property to you, and that I have full authority to transfer the said property to you. I hereby give you this deed of transfer in your name. If there are any arrears of taxes due on the said property, I will pay them myself without any obligation to you. I hereby hereby declare that I am the sole owner of the said property and have full and complete right to transfer the said property to you in the accounts of the said Panchayat. Title Transfer Forms have been filed. I hereby certify that the Scheduled Property is not owned by the Government, is not assigned by the Government, is not mortgaged by the Government and is not allotted for public use.Bk 1, CS No 5170/2022 & Doct No

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 4152 of 2022, dated 02/May/2022, executed by Bapana Lakshmi Narayana in favour of his Son, Bapana Siva Gangadhararao towards the property admeasuring an extent of 48.4 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 3-357, Assessment No. 324, comprised in survey number 211/2, situated in Kesarapalle Village & Grama Panchayati, Gannavaram Mandal, within the District of Krishna, registered at sub-registrar office Gannavaram, is bounded as follows:

North by: Site Gifted To Dhanala Siva Pravti
South by: Donor Property
East by: Chinna Kuduru Venkata Subrahmanyam Site Road
West by: Thulasamma Etc Site
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the scheduled property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
